description: Google Tasks is a free online service that helps manage your to-do lists. You can access Google Tasks via your Google account.
steps: When you create your application, you register it using the Google API Console. Google then provides information you'll need later, such as a client ID and a client secret.
Activate the Google Tasks API in the Google API Console. (If the API isn't listed in the API Console, then skip this step.)
When your application needs access to user data, it asks Google for a particular scope of access.
Google displays a consent screen to the user, asking them to authorize your application to request some of their data.
If the user approves, then Google gives your application a short-lived access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client ID

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Client secret

args.name: code
args.info: Code you received from Google after the user granted access

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The same redirect URL as in received Code step.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client ID

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Client secret

args.name: refreshToken
args.info: A token that you can use to obtain a new access token. Refresh tokens are valid until the user revokes access. Again, this field is only present in this response if you set the access_type parameter to offline in the initial request to Google's authorization server.

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: In some cases a user may wish to revoke access given to an application. A user can revoke access by visiting Account Settings. It is also possible for an application to programmatically revoke the access given to it. Programmatic revocation is important in instances where a user unsubscribes or removes an application. In other words, part of the removal process can include an API request to ensure the permissions granted to the application are removed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The token can be an access token or a refresh token. If the token is an access token and it has a corresponding refresh token, the refresh token will also be revoked.

blocks.name: getAllTaskLists
blocks.description: Returns all the authenticated user's task lists.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of task lists returned on one page. Optional. The default is 100.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying the result page to return. Optional.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields.To display all fields, use `*`. Examples: user,id

structure.name: field
structure.info: Single filed name.To display all fields, use `*`.

blocks.name: getAllTasks
blocks.description: Returns all tasks in the specified task list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it.

args.name: tasklist
args.info: Task list identifier.

args.name: updatedMin
args.info: Lower bound for a task's last modification time (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by last modification time.

args.name: showHidden
args.info: Flag indicating whether hidden tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is False.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: Flag indicating whether deleted tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is False.

args.name: showCompleted
args.info: Flag indicating whether completed tasks are returned in the result. Optional. The default is True.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying the result page to return. Optional.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of task lists returned on one page. Optional. The default is 100.

args.name: dueMin
args.info: Lower bound for a task's due date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by due date.

args.name: dueMax
args.info: Upper bound for a task's due date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by due date.

args.name: completedMax
args.info: Upper bound for a task's completion date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by completion date.

args.name: completedMin
args.info: Lower bound for a task's completion date (as a RFC 3339 timestamp) to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by completion date.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields.To display all fields, use `*`. Examples: user,id

structure.name: field
structure.info: Single filed name.To display all fields, use `*`.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it.

args.name: tasklistId
args.info: Task list identifier.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task list identifier.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields.To display all fields, use `*`. Examples: user,id

structure.name: field
structure.info: Single filed name.To display all fields, use `*`.

blocks.name: createTask
blocks.description: Creates a new task on the specified task list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it.

args.name: links

structure.name: type
structure.info: Type of the link, e.g. `email.

structure.name: description
structure.info: The description. In HTML speak: Everything between and .

structure.name: link
structure.info: The URL.

args.info: Collection of links. This collection is read-only.

args.name: hidden
args.info: Flag indicating whether the task is hidden. This is the case if the task had been marked completed when the task list was last cleared. The default is False. This field is read-only.

args.name: completed
args.info: Flag indicating whether the task has been deleted. The default if False.

args.name: completed
args.info: Completion date of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp). This field is omitted if the task has not been completed.

args.name: due
args.info: Due date of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp). Optional.

args.name: status
args.info: Status of the task. This is either `needsAction` or `completed`.

args.name: notes
args.info: Notes describing the task. Optional.

args.name: tasklistId
args.info: Task list identifier.

args.name: position
args.info: String indicating the position of the task among its sibling tasks under the same parent task or at the top level. If this string is greater than another task's corresponding position string according to lexicographical ordering, the task is positioned after the other task under the same parent task (or at the top level). This field is read-only. Use the `move` method to move the task to another position.

args.name: parent
args.info: Parent task identifier. This field is omitted if it is a top-level task. This field is read-only. Use the `move` method to move the task under a different parent or to the top level.

args.name: selfLink
args.info: URL pointing to this task. Used to retrieve, update, or delete this task.

args.name: updated
args.info: Last modification time of the task (as a RFC 3339 timestamp).

args.name: title
args.info: Title of the task.

args.name: etag
args.info: ETag of the resource.

args.name: id
args.info: Task identifier.

args.name: kind
args.info: Type of the resource.

args.name: parent
args.info: Parent task identifier. If the task is created at the top level, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

args.name: previous
args.info: Previous sibling task identifier. If the task is created at the first position among its siblings, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields.To display all fields, use `*`. Examples: user,id.

structure.name: field
structure.info: Single filed name.To display all fields, use `*`.

blocks.name: moveTask
blocks.description: Moves the specified task to another position in the task list. This can include putting it as a child task under a new parent and/or move it to a different position among its sibling tasks.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token. Use getAccessToken to get it.

args.name: tasklistId
args.info: Task list identifier.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task identifier.

args.name: parent
args.info: New parent task identifier. If the task is moved to the top level, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

args.name: previous
args.info: New previous sibling task identifier. If the task is moved to the first position among its siblings, this parameter is omitted. Optional.

args.name: fields
args.info: List of fields.To display all fields, use `*`. Examples: user,id

structure.name: field
structure.info: Single filed name.To display all fields, use `*`.
